cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest north of the northern Leeward Islands tonight, then turning northwest and eventually north early next week well east of the Bahamas and toward the vicinity of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall currently forecast (stays over open Atlantic)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect only for St. Maarten, St. Martin, and St. Barthelemy
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico may experience squalls, rough surf, and heavy showers as Jerry passes to the north
weather_observation.wind: Isolated tropical-storm-force gusts possible, but sustained winds greater than 34 kt are unlikely (≤4% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; Jerry remains well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain with isolated 3-inch totals possible, leading to brief localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along exposed north-facing beaches.
